intro: Corispermum falcatum, commonly known as the slender sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Eurasia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are narrow and often hairy. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Corispermum falcatum is often found in disturbed habitats and is considered a pioneer species in ecological succession.
